source_sentence: 五母子經
translation: Sutra on the Five Mothers and Children

source_sentence: 吳月氏國居士支謙譯
translation: Wu Yue's translation by Zhi Qian, the national treasurer of Wu Yue

source_sentence: 昔者有阿羅漢在山中奉行道業。
translation: In the past, there was an arhat in a mountain who practiced the path.

source_sentence: 有一小兒年始七歲，大好道法，辭母出家，求作沙彌，隨大沙門，於山中學道，
translation: At the age of seven he renounced his mother’s household life and renounced domestic life. He sought to become a śrāmaṇera (śrāmaṇera). Following the example of a great śramaṇa, he studied the path in the monastery.

source_sentence: 給師所須，誦經行道，時無有懈。
translation: He gave the teacher what he needed, recited the sūtras and practiced the path, and didn't lazy at any time.

source_sentence: 至年八歲得慧眼，能通視無極；
translation: At the age of eight he attained the eye of wisdom and could see without limit.

source_sentence: 耳能徹聽，天上、天下所為善惡，皆聞知之；
translation: Their ears can hear and know all the good and bad deeds of heaven and earth.

source_sentence: 身能飛行，所在至到能分一身及人自化，無所不作；
translation: The body can fly; wherever it is, it can divide the body and human beings into two. There is nothing not to be done.

source_sentence: 自知宿命，所從來生，及人民、蚑行、蠕動之類所經歷善惡之道，皆悉知之。
translation: Knowing their past lives, where they came from and where they came from, as well as the good and bad paths traveled by people, animals, and wriggling creatures, they all know them.

source_sentence: 先世宿命為五母子時，便坐自笑。
translation: In a previous life, when he was the son of five mothers, he sat up and smiled to himself.

source_sentence: 其師問：「何等而笑？」
translation: The teacher asked, What's the reason for laughing?

source_sentence: 沙彌答言：「無所笑也。」
translation: The novice replied, There's nothing to laugh at.

source_sentence: 師曰：「是山中亦無歌唱、伎樂，汝笑嗤我耳？」
translation: The teacher said, There's no singing or music in this mountain, so why are you laughing at me?

source_sentence: 沙彌答言：「不敢笑師，但自笑耳。
translation: The śrāmaṇer replied, I dare not laugh at my teacher; I simply smile for myself.

source_sentence: 我一身為五母作子。
translation: 'In one body, I am the son of five mothers.'

source_sentence: 母皆為我晝夜啼哭，感傷愁毒，不能自止；
translation: All of them cried for me day and night, in distress and grief, unable to stop themselves.

source_sentence: 常念子憂思，未常忽忘。
translation: He always thought of his children with sorrowful thoughts, but he never suddenly forgot them.

source_sentence: 我自念一身而憂毒五家，以是笑耳，不敢笑師。
translation: I thought of myself as a body and grieved for the five families, laughing with my ears and not daring to smile at you.

source_sentence: 「我與第一母作子時，竝隣亦復生子，與我同日而生。
translation: “When I became a child with the first mother, Kaṇṭhaka also gave birth to another child, who was born on the same day as me.

source_sentence: 其子出入行步，我母見之，便悲念：『我子在者，亦當出入行步如是。』
translation: When that child leaves, enters, and walks, my mother saw him and then sadly thought, 'If my child is here, he'll also leave, enter, and walk like this.'

source_sentence: 愁毒淚下如雨，悲言念子。
translation: The tears of grief and sorrow poured down like rain, and he said, Sadly, I'm thinking to my son.

source_sentence: 「我為第二母作子時，我短命又早死。
translation: “When I became the second mother’s child, my life came to an end and died too soon.

source_sentence: 我母見人乳兒，便念乳我，悲哀涕泣，言念我子。
translation: Seeing someone nursing a child, my mother thinks of me as she nurses him. She weeps in sorrow and cries out in tears, saying, “This is my child!

source_sentence: 「我為第三母作子時，我年十歲，復少死。
translation: “When I became my third mother’s child, when I was ten years old, I again died young.

source_sentence: 母臨食悲哭泣淚，言念：『我子在者，亦當與我共食。
translation: When the mother was about to eat, she cried in sorrow and said, 'If my child is here, he'll also share food with me.

source_sentence: 捨我死去，使我獨食。』
translation: They abandoned me and died, leaving me to eat alone.'

source_sentence: 哽咽言念我。
translation: He choked and said, Think of me.

source_sentence: 「復為第四母作子時，我薄命先死。
translation: Again, when the fourth mother gave birth to a child, my life died before I did.

source_sentence: 我等輩娶婦，我母見之，即念：『我子在者，亦當為子娶婦。』
translation: When we all married our wives, my mother saw her and thought, 'If my son is here, I'll also marry my wife for him.'

source_sentence: 言：『我何負蒼天而殺我子！』
translation: He said, 'Why did I carry the blue sky and kill my child?'

source_sentence: 「復為第五母作子時，我始年七歲，好道辭家，捨母隨師，入山求道，
translation: Again, when the fifth mother became my child, I was seven years old. Having renounced household life at the age of seven years old, I abandoned my mother and went forth into the mountains to seek religious practice.

source_sentence: 得羅漢道。
translation: He attained the path of the arhat.

source_sentence: 我母日日啼哭言：『我生一子，隨師學道，不知所在，飢飽寒溫，不知生死，
translation: Every day my mother cried in tears, saying, “I gave birth to a child who followed his teacher and studied the path but did not know where he was. He suffered from hunger and thirst as well as cold and hot weather and did not know birth and death.

source_sentence: 不復相見。』
translation: They won't see each other again.'

source_sentence: 愁毒言念我子。
translation: They're sad and poisonous, saying, Remember me, my child.

source_sentence: 「是五母適共一會，各各言亡我子，相對啼哭，不能相止。
translation: “These five mothers each said that they had lost their children, weeping and crying to each other but they couldn’t stop.

source_sentence: 是我一身一魄，展轉而與五母腹中作子，固疑惑人，而使眾悲哭發狂，
translation: I am one body, one soul, with five mothers in my womb as my offspring. I am a man who doubts the existence of all living beings and causes them to wail in distress.

source_sentence: 但共念我一身耳，各欲自殺，是故笑耳。
translation: They simply think of me as one body, each wanting to kill themselves. That's why they laugh.

source_sentence: 「發念世間凡人，不知死當有所至生，皆共言死耳。
translation: Ordinary people in the world who give rise to this thought don't know that death will lead to birth, and they all say death together.

source_sentence: 凡人何能知死當有生，作善自得其福，作惡得其殃，不有所遺人。
translation: How can ordinary people know that death will have birth, attain its own merit by doing what's good, or attain its own misfortune by doing what's bad, without leaving anyone behind?

source_sentence: 在世間皆為惡業，無所畏難，死後當入泰山地獄中，苦痛極哉，後悔無所復及。
translation: In the world, they'll all do bad actions and have no fear or difficulty, and after death they'll go into Mount Tai Hell, which is so painful and painful that there's nothing more to regret.

source_sentence: 「我厭世間勤苦，故辭父母，入山精進求道。
translation: Because I am disgusted with worldly suffering and worldly strife, I renounced my parents’ household life and went up into the mountains to earnestly seek the path.

source_sentence: 今我目見畜生、餓鬼、地獄中代之恐怖。
translation: Now, with my eyes, I've seen the fear of animals, hungry ghosts, and hell in their place.

source_sentence: 今被蒙佛恩，得聞經法。
translation: Now, thanks to the Buddha's kindness, I've been able to hear the sūtras and teachings.

source_sentence: 今我日夜憐傷五母不能自脫反憂，我所求願皆以得，念世間人展轉相生，
translation: Day and night, out of pity for my five mothers who are unable to free themselves from their sorrow, I obtain all the wishes I seek.

source_sentence: 亦復相笑，無有休息。
translation: They also smiled, ceaselessly.

source_sentence: 身皆歸土，魂當所作，隨其善惡，皆不能自拔。
translation: Their bodies all return to the land, and whatever their souls do, good or bad, they can't pull themselves out.

source_sentence: 斷其恩愛，能離貪欲，可得度脫。
translation: By stopping their love and affection, they'll be able to part with craving and be liberated.

source_sentence: 我以不復與生死會，我恨身以斷，如人不種，當泥洹道最樂，長復與勤苦。」
translation: It's because I won't be able to share the assembly of birth and death again, and because my hateful body will be cut off like a person who doesn't plant seeds, the path of nirvāṇa will be most pleasant, and I'll continue to share the suffering of hardship for a long time.

source_sentence: 為師說之，已便飛去。
translation: Explain it to the teacher, and he'll fly away.

source_sentence: 佛說五母子經
translation: Foshuo 五母子經, Sutra of the Five Mothers
